intro: Pycnostachys longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bract strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its dense, bract-covered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, with lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture, though it remains relatively rare in the wild.
